CatDescriptText: Miss Hilda Kellum, 1621 Singer Place, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 4, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Sherman Adams was guilty of misconduct in office of assistant to the President? Do you think that he should have resigned?" answer reads: "I don't know.  From what I've seen in the papers, some say that he is, while others say that he is not guilty of misconduct in office.  I say that he is.  Yes, he should have resigned like he did.  And he did this in a nice way."
TitMainTitle: Hilda Kellum wearing short sleeve patterned blouse, carrying drawstring handbag, standing with girl wearing dress with light colored v-shaped overlay on bodice, carrying dark handbag, standing in front of swirled granite wall, Wood Street, Downtown
